author: @Ramimelene
text: All of your series are great! Thanks for sharing all these. How can one run the entire code though with tensorflow 2?

author: @rh3niumdagamer708
text: a bit late to the party... (thanks for the vids, btw) for the platform specific encoding one could have the system decide via e.g.: import platform if platform.system() == "Windows":     fourcc = cv2.VideoWriter_fourcc(*"XVID") elif platform.system() == "Darwin":     # Mac platform I am not sure which     fourcc = cv2.VideoWriter_fourcc('M', 'J', 'P', 'G') elif platform.system() == "Linux":     fourcc = cv2.VideoWriter_fourcc(*"MJPG")

author: @Silver-fh4fb
text: Great tutorial. Already churning out frames. Interestingly, running this code in a vmware ubuntu vm was not slower than running it on a gpu. Went through a few hours trying to get tensorflow working on my gpu in windows and didn't see any gains. However task manager shows that gpu usage is 10% so i don't know whats going on.

author: @Creuilcreuil
text: fourcc(*"XVID") is equal to fourcc("X", "V", "I", "D"), so you could write fourcc(*"MJPG") for linux the star operator in front on an iterable, in function call take each element of that iterable and pass them as separate argument
